properties.headline: Australia Day in the Sydney CBD - Sunday 26 January - SYDNEY CBD, CIRCULAR QUAY, THE ROCKS various roads north of Bridge St
properties.publicTransport: Plenty of extra services will run, plan your trip at transportnsw.info.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Sydney CBD Road closure & clearways map - Australia Day 2020
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Sydney CBD Road closure & clearways map - Australia Day 2020

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Milsons Point Road closure & clearways map - Australia Day 2020
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Milsons Point Road closure & clearways map - Australia Day 2020

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and parking restrictions will be in place for Australia Day events in the city and Milsons Point. Up to 65,000 people are expected to attend evening events at Circular Quay. 

Key road closures:

4am to midnight: George St from Essex St to Hickson Rd. George St between Hickson Rd and Lower Fort St will remain closed until Monday 27 January for The Rocks Markets trading.

7am to midnight: Hickson Rd from George St to Pottinger St.

7am to 10am: Hickson Rd from Napoleon St to Towns Place (for 10km wheelchair race).

7am to 11am: Hickson Rd from Towns Place to Pottinger St (for 10km wheelchair race).

4pm to midnight: roads north of Bridge St including sections of Alfred St, Albert St, George St, Pitt St, Loftus St, Young St & Phillip St.

7.30pm to 10.30pm: Cahill Expressway lanes 7 & 8 and Circular Quay Overpass, Lane 4 on the Harbour Bridge. The speed limit will be reduced to 40km/hr on Sydney Harbour Bridge between 8pm and 9:30pm. Cahill Expressway overpass walk will be closed from 4pm to 9:30pm. Sydney Harbour Bridge Walkway and Cycleway will remain open.

8.30pm to 10.30pm: Macquarie St north of Bridge St, sections of Grosvenor St and Bridge St from York St to Macquarie St, George St and Bond St. Note: no access to/from Opera House Wilson Carpark during this time 

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect on roads around Circular Quay and The Rocks from 3am with additional clearways in place from 2pm on most major roads in the Sydney CBD until midnight.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, even for local residents or RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

CIRCULAR QUAY / THE ROCKS

FROM 4AM TO MIDNIGHT 

  • Alfred Street between George Street and Pitt Street

  • Circular Quay West from Argyle Street

  • Mill Lane between George Street and Kendall Lane
  • Pitt Street between Alfred Street and Reiby Place

FROM 4AM SUNDAY 26 JAN TO 10PM MONDAY 27 JAN

  • George Street between Lower Fort Street and Hickson Road (closed for Rocks Markets)

  • Towns Place between Dalgety Road and Hickson Road

FROM 7AM TO 11AM

  • Hickson Road* between Towns Place and Pottinger Street

Notes: *Pottinger Street access via Windmill Street

THE ROCKS

FROM 7AM TO MIDNIGHT

Notes: * roads will close at various times between 3pm and 8.30pm subject to NSW Police discretion dependant on the size of the crowds arriving into the city during this time

SYDNEY HARBOUR BRIDGE AND CAHILL EXPRESSWAY

FROM 7.30PM TO 10.30PM

  • Sydney Harbour Bridge lane 4 Bradfield Highway

SYDNEY CBD

FROM 8.30PM TO 10.30PM

WALKWAY CLOSURES

FROM 4PM TO 9.30PM

  • Cahill Walk on the Cahill Expressway Circular Quay Overpass between The Royal Botanic Garden and The Rocks

HEAVY AND OVERSIZE VEHICLE DETOUR

FROM 7.30PM TO 10.30PM

Due to the closure of the Sydney Harbour Bridge lanes 4, 7, and 8, and the Cahill Expressway Circular Quay overpass, heavy and oversize vehicles travelling south will exit via York Street or the Western Distributor. Access to the Eastern Distributor and City East is via Bent Street and Shakespeare Place.

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones, even for local residents or RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed called 132 701 to find its new location. Clearways are in place on both sides unless stated otherwise.

properties.headline: Sydney Lunar Festival - Saturday 25 January - HAYMARKET Various including Harbour St, Hay St and Thomas St at Chinatown
properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 20,000 people are expected to attend the Sydney Lunar Festival 2020 in Chinatown from 5pm until 10pm. 

Road closures will be in place from 12pm midday Saturday until 1am Sunday on sections of Factory St, Harbour St, Hay St, Little Hay St, Little Pier St, Kimber Lane, Sussex St and Thomas St. 

Special event clearways will be in effect from 10am Saturday until 1am Sunday on sections of Harbour St, Hay St, Little Hay St, Sussex St and Thomas St. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, even for local residents or RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time, follow the direction of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your car is towed, call the Traffic Information Line on 132 701 to find its new location.

HAYMARKET 

FROM 10AM SATURDAY 25 JANUARY UNTIL 1AM SUNDAY 26 JANUARY

  • Harbour Street between Hay Street and Goulburn Street
  • Hay Street between George Street and Harbour Street 
  • Little Hay Street between Sussex Street and Harbour Street 
  • Sussex Street between Goulburn Street and Hay Street
  • Thomas Street between Hay Street and Marigold Carpark Driveway (approx. 20m)

properties.headline: Hurstville Lunar New Year Festival - Saturday 18 January - HURSTVILLE Forest Road between Queens Road AND Treacy Street
properties.publicTransport: Buses will be using alternate stops on Barratt St and Crofts Ave while closures are in place. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Lunar NY Festival Hurstville - Road closure & clearway map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Lunar NY Festival Hurstville - Road closure & clearway map

properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 50,000 people are expected to attend the annual Lunar New Year Street Festival on Forest Rd at Hurstville from 10am to 5pm. Road closures and special event clearways will be in place to support the event. 

Forest Rd will be closed between Queens Rd and Treacy St from 1am to 11:30pm. Closures will also be in place on sections of MacMahon St and Woodville Lane during this time. 

Special event clearways will be in effect from 7am to 4pm on Forest Rd between Gloucester Rd and Bridge St and on Queens Rd between Park Rd and The Avenue.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

Motorists are advised to allow additional travel time as traffic will be heavier than usual on roads in the area including King Georges Rd, Queens Rd and Railway Pde.

arrangementElements.html:
HURSTVILLE

ROAD CLOSURES

FROM 1AM TO 11:30PM

  • Forest Road between Queens Road and Treacy Street
  • MacMahon Street between Forest Road and Dora Street
  • Woodville Lane between Forest Road and Barratt Street

SPECIAL EVENT CLEARWAYS

FROM 7AM TO 4PM

  • Forest Road between Gloucester Road and Bridge Street
  • Queens Road between Park Road and The Avenue
arrangementElements.title: Road Closures & Special Event Clearways

properties.displayName: Hurstville Lunar New Year Festival - Saturday 18 January

properties.headline: Concert - Friday 24 January - PARRAMATTA O'Connell Street at Victoria Rd
properties.publicTransport: Concert tickets include travel on public transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Bankwest Stadium event day road closures and detour routes
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Bankwest Stadium event day road closures and detour routes

properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the first concert at Bankwest Stadium for the Cold Chisel Blood Moon Tour from 5pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd as large crowds travel to the stadium during Friday evening peak. Motorists should plan to arrive early and allow extra travel time.

Roads around the stadium will close prior to the end of the concert and reopen once crowds have safely cleared the precinct including:

- O’Connell St from Grose St to George St

- Ross St from O’Connell St to Trott St

- Victoria Rd from O’Connell St to Villiers St

Motorists are advised to allow plenty of extra travel time and detour around the closures via Parkes St, Harris St, Macarthur St and Isabella St or Victoria Rd instead to avoid delays.

properties.headline: BBL Cricket - Thursday 16 January - MOORE PARK various roads incl Albion St, Moore Park Rd, Anzac Pde, Lang Rd approaching The SCG
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.linkName: Moore Park walking route and transport map

properties.otherAdvice:
BBL Cricket: Sydney Sixers v Hobart Hurricanes at the SCG from 7:10pm until 10:10pm

Traffic may be heavier than normal on roads approaching Moore Park including Anzac Pde, Southern Cross Dr, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed before, during and after the event.

Special event clearways will be in place on various roads around Moore Park from 3pm until 11pm.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your car is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

SURRY HILLS / MOORE PARK

FROM 3PM TO 11PM

  • Albion Street between Mary Street and Flinders Street (northern side)
  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (southern side)
  • Chalmers Street 1 between Cleveland Street and Randle Street (both sides)
  • Cleveland Street 2 between City Road and South Dowling Street (both sides)
  • Flinders Street between Albion Street and Moore Park Road (eastern side)
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (both sides)
  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides) Moore Park
  • Road between Flinders Street and Driver Avenue (northern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Poate Road and Regent Street (southern side - taxis excepted)
  • Moore Park Road between Regent Street and Driver Avenue (southern side - buses excepted)
  • Moore Park Road between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side) 

Notes: 

  1. Additional special event clearways will be in effect on both sides of Chalmers Street between Cleveland and Devonshire Streets at Central to accommodate rail replacement buses for Sydney Trains trackwork. Clearways will be in effect from 2am Saturday 11 January to 2am Monday 13 January, 2am Saturday 15 February to 2am Monday 17 February, and 2am Saturday 22 February to 2am Monday 24 February.
  2. Existing clearways on Cleveland Street between City Road and South Dowling Street are in effect from 6am to 7pm, seven days a week. On event days, these clearways will be extended to the times noted above.

properties.headline: !Disregard But Do Not Delete! - BROKEN HILL Blende Street
Australia Day in Parramatta - Sunday 26 January - PARRAMATTA O'Connell St at Parramatta Park
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend Australia Day events at Parramatta Park throughout the day from 6am until 9.15pm.

Parramatta Park is vehicle-free on Australia Day. There is no access for vehicle traffic from 1pm on Saturday 25 January through until midnight on Sunday 26 January.

Lane 1 northbound on O’Connell St at George St will be closed from 7pm until 11pm to allow for crowds to safely leave the park after the festivities.

A pick up and drop off zone will be managed along lanes 1 and 2 on Pitt St between Hunter St and Macquarie St from 6am to 11pm. The speed limit will also be reduced to 40km/h along this section of Pitt St, Macquarie St and O’Connell St to Victoria Rd.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and consider alternate routes.
properties.displayName: Australia Day in Parramatta - Sunday 26 January

properties.headline: Australia Day at The Entrance - Sunday 26 January - THE ENTRANCE The Entrance Rd, Marine Pde and Coral St approaching Memorial Park
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 15,000 people are expected to attend Australia Day celebrations at Memorial Park in The Entrance from 2pm until 9pm.

Sections of Marine Pde, Coral St East, Victoria Ave, The Entrance Rd and Beach Rd will be closed between 4pm and 10pm. Local diversions will be in place and resident access will be maintained when possible. 

Coral St West and Torrens Ave will also be under traffic control. The Marine Parade car park will be closed from midnight Saturday 25 January until 10pm on Sunday 26 January. 

Traffic is expected to be heavier than normal along the Central Coast Hwy as crowds make their way to and from the event.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of changed traffic conditions in the area.

arrangementElements.html:
THE ENTRANCE 

FROM 4PM UNTIL 10PM

  • Marine Parade at Duffy’s Lane
  • Coral St East at Central Coast Hwy
  • Victoria Ave at Torrens Ave
  • The Entrance Rd at Victoria Ave
  • Marine Parade at Beach Rd
  • Beach Rd at Ocean Pde
arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

properties.displayName: Australia Day at The Entrance - Sunday 26 January

webLinks.linkText: Australia Day events at Woy Woy

properties.headline: Australia Day at Woy Woy - Sunday 26 January - WOY WOY The Boulevarde, Brick Wharf Rd, Brisbane Water Dr
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend Australia Day celebrations along the waterfront at Woy Woy from 2pm until 9pm. 

Road closures and changed access arrangements will be in place:

From 6am to 10:30pm: The Boulevarde and Brick Wharf Rd will close between Chamber Place/Brisbane Water Drive and Tennis Court Lane.

From 9pm to 9:30pm: Brisbane Water Drive will close between The Spike Milligan Bridge and The Boulevarde at the Railway St intersection. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads through the area and be aware of the changed traffic conditions.
properties.displayName: Australia Day at Woy Woy - Sunday 26 January

roads.mainStreet: The Boulevarde, Brick Wharf Rd, Brisbane Water Dr

properties.headline: A-League - Sunday 19 January - PARRAMATTA O'Connell St at Victoria Rd
properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on public transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Bankwest Stadium event day road closures and detour routes
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Bankwest Stadium event day road closures and detour routes

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Western Sydney Wanderers v Perth Glory at Bankwest Stadium, pre-game from 4pm and main game from 6:30pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd as large crowds travel to the stadium. Motorists should plan to arrive early and allow extra travel time.

Roads around the stadium may close prior to full-time and reopen once crowds have safely cleared the precinct including:

  • O’Connell St from Grose St to George St
  • Ross St from O’Connell St to Trott St
  • Victoria Rd from O’Connell St to Villiers St

Motorists are advised to allow extra travel time and detour around the closures via Parkes St, Harris St, Macarthur St and Isabella St or Victoria Rd instead to avoid delays.

properties.headline: Triathlon - Sunday 16 February - WOY WOY McMasters Rd at Blackwell Rd
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 1,500 people will take part in the Woy Woy Kids TRY-athlon held at various Woy Woy venues including the Peninsula Leisure Centre, James Browne Oval and local roads from 9am until 12pm midday.

Road closures will be in place from 7am until 1pm on McMasters Rd between Blackwall Rd and Ocean Beach Rd and on Welcome St between McMasters Rd and Alpha St. Local detours will be in place. Access to McMasters Rd at Blackwall Rd will also be restricted. 

Motorists should allow additional travel time, be aware of increased pedestrian activity and follow the direction of traffic controllers.

properties.headline: Rugby 7's - Saturday 1 and Sunday 2 February - PARRAMATTA O'Connell St at Victoria Rd
properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on trains. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Bankwest Stadium event day road closures and detour routes
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Bankwest Stadium event day road closures and detour routes

properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the Rugby 7's at Bankwest Stadium on Saturday and Sunday at Bankwest Stadium.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd as large crowds travel to the stadium. Motorists should plan to arrive early and allow extra travel time.

Roads around the stadium may close prior to full-time of the final game each night and reopen once crowds have safely cleared the precinct including:

  • O’Connell St from Grose St to George St
  • Ross St from O’Connell St to Trott St
  • Victoria Rd from O’Connell St to Villiers St

Motorists are advised to allow extra travel time and detour around the closures via Parkes St, Harris St, Macarthur St and Isabella St or Victoria Rd instead to avoid delays.

properties.headline: Concert - Saturday 18 January - POKOLBIN Broke Rd at McDonalds Rd
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the Cold Chisel concert at the Hope Estate Winery in the Hunter Valley from midday. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time on Wine Country Dr, McDonalds Rd and Broke Rd approaching the venue.

Attendees travelling via the Hunter Expressway can exit at the Branxton Interchange and use Wine Country Dr, and then either McDonalds Rd or Broke Rd to access the event.

properties.headline: A-League - Saturday 25 January - GOSFORD Dane Dr between Central Coast Hwy AND Donnison St
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Central Coast Mariners v Brisbane Roar at Central Coast Stadium from 5pm to 7pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than normal on the Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to the game.

Dane Dr between Georgiana Terrace and Donnison St will close before the game and re-open once crowds have safely cleared the area.

Motorists should be aware of changed traffic conditions in the area before, during and after the game and follow instructions of traffic controllers on site.

properties.headline: Australia Day at Rooty Hill - Sunday 26 January - ROOTY HILL Church St
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend Australia Day at The Rooty Hill park from 4pm to 9:30pm.

Church St will be closed at Rooty Hill Rd South from 10am. Access will be maintained for local traffic and vehicles with event passes only.

There is no vehicle traffic permitted in Rooty Hill park from 8:30pm.

Temporary no stopping restrictions will be in place on sections of Eastern Rd, Rooty Hill Rd South, Church St and Francis Rd.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on Eastern Rd, Francis Rd and Rooty Hill Rd South and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.
properties.displayName: Australia Day at Rooty Hill - Sunday 26 January

properties.headline: A-League - Friday 31 January - KOGARAH Jubilee Ave, English St and Park St at Princes Hwy
properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on public transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Sydney FC v Brisbane Roar at Netstrata Jubilee Stadium from 7:30pm.

Traffic is expected to be heavy in both directions on the Princes Hwy approaching Kogarah as crowds travel to and from the game during Friday evening peak.

Road closures will be in place before the game on the following roads around the stadium:

- Jubilee Ave between the Princes Hwy and Park St

- English St between the Princes Hwy and High St

- Park St between Jubilee Ave and English St

Roads will re-open an hour after full-time or once crowds have cleared the area.

roads.mainStreet: Jubilee Ave, English St and Park St

properties.headline: Fun Run - Saturday 16 February - RHODES TO OLYMPIC PARK Bennelong Bridge at Hill Rd
properties.publicTransport: Buses in Olympic Park will be affected. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 1,000 people are expected to participate in the annual Billbergia Bennelong Bridge Run from 7:15am to 10am.

Bennelong Bridge from Shoreline Dr and Waterways St will be closed from 5am to 10am along with sections of Waterways St, Wentworth St, Wentworth Pl and Shoreline Dr.

Sections of Hill Rd, Kevin Coombs Ave and the Holker Busway will close from 5am until 9am. Lane closures will be in place from 5am until 10am on sections of Jamieson St and Holker St. 

Detours around the closures will be via the P5 Loop Rd. Motorists travelling around Rhodes, Wentworth Point and Olympic Park should allow additional travel time, be aware of changed traffic conditions and increased pedestrian activity.

arrangementElements.html:
RHODES, OLYMPIC PARK AND WENTWORTH POINT

ROAD CLOSURES

FROM 5AM UNTIL 11AM

  • Wentworth Place between Burroway Road and Footbridge Boulevarde

FROM 5AM UNTIL 10AM

  • Bennelong Bridge between Shoreline Drive and Waterways Street
  • Waterways Street between Park Street North and Half Street
  • Wentworth Place between Footbridge Boulevard and Half Street
  • Shoreline Dr between Mary St & Gauthorpe St

FROM 5AM UNIL 9AM

  • Hill Road between Holker Street and the P5 Loop Road (both directions)
  • Hill Road between the P5 Loop Road and Bennelong Parkway (northbound)
  • Holker Busway between Hill Rd and Kevin Coombs Avenue
  • Kevin Coombs Avenue between Olympic Boulevard and Australia Avenue (eastbound)

LANE CLOSURES

FROM 5AM UNTIL 10AM

  • Jamieson Street between shared path and Holker Street (southbound lane)
  • Holker Street between Jamieson Street and Hill Road (eastbound lane)
arrangementElements.title: Road closures

properties.headline: Australia Day at Dee Why - Sunday 26 January - DEE WHY The Strand between Dee Why Parade AND Oaks Avenue
properties.publicTransport: Buses will be diverting around the Strand and use stops on Howard Ave. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the Australia Day Big BBQ at James Meehan Reserve and Ted Jackson Reserve from 8am to 12pm.

Road closures will be in place from 12pm midday Saturday 25 January until 4pm Sunday 26 January on The Strand between Dee Why Pde and Oaks Ave and on Howard Ave between Clyde Ave and The Strand.

Resident access to Howard Ave will be maintained via Clyde Rd throughout the closure period.

Special event clearways will also be in effect from 12pm midday on Saturday to 4pm on Sunday along The Strand between Dee Why Parade and Oaks Avenue.

 Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.
properties.displayName: Australia Day at Dee Why - Sunday 26 January

properties.headline: Expo - Friday 7 to Sunday 9 February - BROADMEADOW Griffiths Rd, Chatham Rd approaching Newcastle Showground and Entertainment Centre
properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the 2020 Caravan and Camping Expo at Newcastle Showground and Entertainment Centre in Broadmeadow from 9am to 5pm on Friday and Saturday, and 9am to 4pm on Sunday.

Motorists should allow extra travel time as traffic is expected to be heavier than normal on Griffiths Rd, Turton and Lambton Rd, particularly during Friday afternoon peak.

properties.headline: Country Music Festival - Friday 17 to Sunday 26 January - TAMWORTH Peel St, Kable Ave, Fitzroy St
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the 48th annual country music festival in Tamworth from Friday 17 January until Sunday 26 January.

Road closures will be in place for the event between Thursday 16 and Tuesday 28 January:

  • Peel St between White St and Brisbane St closed from 4am Thursday 16 January to 7pm Monday 27 January
  • Fitzroy St between Smith Pl and Kable Ave closed from 6am Wednesday 15 January to 6am Tuesday 28 January
  • Kable Ave between Brisbane St and south of Fitzroy St closed from 5am Wednesday 15 January to 12pm midday Tuesday 28 January

The speed limit will be reduced to 40km/h along sections of Brisbane St.

Motorists travelling in the area during the festival should be aware of changed access conditions and follow the direction of traffic controllers and police on site.
properties.displayName: Country Music Festival - Friday 17 to Sunday 26 January

roads.mainStreet: Peel St, Kable Ave, Fitzroy St

properties.headline: Street Festival - Saturday 8 February - WYONG Alison Rd and local roads at Pacific Hwy
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the Love Lanes Festival at the Chapman Building in Wyong from 4pm to 9pm.

Local roads will close between 6am and 11pm including Robleys Ln, Alison Rd, Hely St, Bakers Ln, Peters Ln and Rankens Circuit. There will be no access to Alison Rd, Bakers Ln and Robleys Ln from the Pacific Hwy during this time. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual along the Pacific Hwy through Wyong while road closures are in place.

properties.headline: Opera in The Domain - Saturday 18 January - SYDNEY CBD Art Gallery Road, Mrs Macquaries Road & Hospital Rd approaching The Domain
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 20,000 people are expected to attend Opera in the Domain from 4pm to 10:30pm. 

Art Gallery Rd and Hospital Rd will be closed to inbound traffic from 8:30pm until 11:30pm.

Vehicles can exit during this period, however NSW Police may hold traffic as pedestrians leave the concert from 10:30pm.

Additional roads in the area may close to allow for crowds to safely leave the area.

Motorists are advised to allow additional travel time, be aware of increased pedestrian activity or use alternate routes.
properties.displayName: Opera in The Domain - Saturday 18 January

roads.mainStreet: Art Gallery Road, Mrs Macquaries Road & Hospital Rd

properties.headline: Triathlon - Sunday 26 January - NEWCASTLE Wharf Rd, Nobbys Rd, Shortland Esplanade
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The 2020 Newcastle Paratriathlon Oceania Championships will take place at Newcastle Harbour Foreshore and Newcastle East from 7am until 9:30am. 

Road closures will be in place from 5:30am until 9:30am on sections of Wharf Rd from Queens Wharf, Nobbys Rd from Watt St and Shortland Espl to Church St.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the area and local detours will be in place.

Motorists should allow additional travel time, follow the direction of traffic controllers and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

roads.mainStreet: Wharf Rd, Nobbys Rd, Shortland Esplanade
